TI RETRACTED: A Dynamic Mapping Algorithm for Graph Isomorphism (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE graph isomorphism; algorithm; DMAGI; dynamic mapping; pattern
   recognition
AB The graph isomorphism problem is still an open question if it is NP-Complete or not. This paper proposed a dynamic mapping algorithm for graph isomorphism (DMAGI). DMAGI used Length-L path numbers as partition metrics which could divide not similar vertices into trivial cells easily. For those similar vertices, DMAGI took a dynamic mapping procedure. DMAGI was tested on graphs such as: random connected graphs, pseudo random k-regular graphs, regular rings, and regular 2D meshes. The results indicate that the time requirement of DMAGI don't increase exponentially with the graph size of all these types. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Tian, Lijun; Liu, Chaoqun; Xie, Jianquan] Hunan Univ Finance & Econ, Dept Informat Technol, 139 Fenglin 2nd Rd, Changsha 410205, Hunan, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Stability results for neural networks of neutral-type with
   discrete interval and unbounded distributed delays (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Stability; neural networks; neutral-type; lyapunov-krasovskii
   functional; unbounded distributed delays
ID GLOBAL ROBUST STABILITY; STATE ESTIMATION; EXPONENTIAL STABILITY; LMI
   APPROACH; TIME DELAYS
AB This paper investigates the stability criterion of neural networks of neutral-type with discrete interval and unbounded distributed delays. A new delay-dependent condition is obtained by using more general Lyapunov-Krasovskii functionals. Meanwhile, this condition is expressed in terms of a linear matrix inequality (LMI), which can be checked easily using the MATLAB LMI toolbox. A numerical example is given to illustrate the availability of the proposed results. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Temperature Control System of Resistance-heated Furnace Based
   on Variable Fuzzy-PI Control (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Fuzzy-PI control; resistance-heated furnace; temperature control
ID DESIGN
AB In order to solve the problem that resistance-heated furnace has the disadvantage of non-linearity, slow time-variant and large delay and so on, a temperature control system of the resistance-heated furnace has been designed according to the fuzzy-PI algorithm. Because this method has the merits of both PI and fuzzy control, the temperature control effect is improved to large extent. When the temperature error between given value and measured value is too large, the fuzzy control is adopted. When the error is too small, the PI control is used. The simulation test is performed by MATLAB, and the results indicate that this system has the advantages of small overshoot, short adjusting time and good robustness. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Design on Fuzzy Neural Network Temperature Controller of
   Heating Furnace (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Fuzzy control; heating furnace; neural network; temperature control
AB In order to solve these disadvantages of non-linearity, time variant and large delay of heating furnace, a fuzzy neural network temperature controller is designed according to the fuzzy control and neural network theory. In this controller, not only can the reasoning process of neural network be described by the fuzzy rules, but also the fuzzy rules can be dynamically adjusted by the neural network. Moreover, the learning algorithm of the fuzzy neural network temperature controller is given. Simulation results show that the fuzzy neural network temperature controller has good regulating performance, and it can meet the requirement of heating furnace during industrial production. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Diesel Engine Air Tightness Feature Recognitionbased on
   Multi-scale Analysis (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Cylinder air tightness; starting voltage; mallat algorithm; feature
   recognition
AB Cylinder air tightness is an important indicator to the comprehensive performance of internal combustion engine. It can be got the low-frequency and high-frequency signals of the starting voltage waveform using multi-scale analysis method and by binary discrete wavelet transform with the Mallat algorithm. The experiment results show that the working conditions of diesel engine starting process can be shown from the low-frequency signals, and the main frequency distribution can be recognised from the high frequency partial. This algorithm can effectively identify signal characteristics, and provide a reliable basis for signal feature recognition. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Load's 2-Degree of Freedom Swing Angle Model and Dynamic
   Simulation for Overhead Crane or Gantry Crane (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE gantry crane; overhead crane; crane-trolley-load; load's swing angle;
   dynamic simulation
AB Exactly positioning of the trolley and promptly eliminating of the load swing for bridge crane are efficient approaches in order to improve the operational efficiency of over-head cranes and gantry cranes. So, it is necessary that model construction for dynamic equations of the trolley-load system and finding out load swing rules and decision factors of load's swing angel while studying anti-swing control scheme. Construct 2-degree of freedom angel's math model of the load-swing through constructing the trolley-load system's dynamic 3-dimention (3-D) equations, and properly simplify those equations. The rope's length of load and trolley-acceleration can obviously affect the swing angel's value of load. Dynamic simulation results show that the rope-length's force is more prominent than the trolley-acceleration's for the swing angel of load and the trolley's running acceleration (deceleration) can obviously affect the value of load's swing angle when the rope length is determined, the value will increase with increasing acceleration (deceleration), and the trolley's running acceleration (deceleration) can not obviously affect the load's swing frequency. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Research of backlash nonlinearity on three-axis inertial
   stabilized platform (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Three-axis Inertial Stabilized Platform; Backlash; Vibration; Accuracy;
   modeling
AB Backlash nonlinearity exists widely in Three-axis Inertial Stabilized Platform with large torque, which has great influence on the dynamic and static properties of the platform. So a Three-axis Inertial Stabilized Platform control system with backlash was discussed. The structure and parameters of regulator of system were designed. Then the mathematic model of Three-axis Inertial Stabilized Platform control system was established by Simulink. The dynamic characters of the system were analyzed. The backlash nonlinear of drive system was lead in. The stability of system influenced by gear backlash was analyzed. It will positively guide the design of the mechanical drive and control systems. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Research of noise suppression for MEMS gyro ADXRS150
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE drift error; the time series theory; Kalman filter; noise suppression
AB The random drift of MEMS gyro is too large due to these effects of external environmental factors and manufacturing imperfect. In order to compensate the random drift error of an ADXRS150 MEMS gyro, in this paper, the output of ADXRS150 in static are sampled. Then based on the time series theory, ARIMA model of ADXRS150 output data is established. Taken this model as the state equation and the sampled data as the measurement equation, the Kalman filter is designed to process the data. These conclusions in the final part of this paper indicate that the model and the filtering method can can restrain the gyro noise of the MEMS gyro ADXRS150 and improve its precision effectively and greatly. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Multi-Channel Assignment and Switching Based Routing
   Protocol for Mobile Internet (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Mobile Internet; Multi-Channel Routing; Channel Assignment
ID MAC PROTOCOL; NETWORKS
AB In this paper, we explore the problem of multi-channel assignment and switching based routing for Mobile Internet. A new routing schema to solve this problem is presented, which is called Multi-channel Assignment and Switching based Routing, namely MASR. In this method, node-based channel assignment is considered, and we introduce the concept of dependent router, with which a hierarchical and fragmented routing protocol is proposed. Extensive simulations are conducted and the results have shown that compared with MCRP and MCP-LB, our schema has better performance. It can improve the total throughput of the network greatly. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Traffic flow prediction based on artificial life and RBF
   nerual network (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE traffic flow; artificial life; RBF nerual network; prediction method
ID NEURAL-NETWORKS
AB The prediction of traffic flow is very key importance for the traffic plan, traffic management, traffic control and safety. RBF neural network is a kind of feed-forward neural network, which is composed of the different layers with the input layer, hidden layer and output layer. The hybrid method of artificial life and RBF nerual network is presented to predict the traffic flow. The experimental data are used to testify the traffic flow prediction ability of the hybrid method of artificial life and RBF nerual network. It can be seen that the traffic flow prediction results of the hybrid method of artificial life and RBF nerual network are better than those of RBF nerual network and BP nerual network. TI RETRACTED: Method of Dual-process Synchronization control and Time
   Information Processing in Wireless Structure Health Monitoring
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Time synchronization; synchronization control; time information
AB Synchronization control is indispensable for the application of wireless sensor networks (WSN) in structure health monitoring (SHM), and it is fundamental for the field diagnosis in this kind of application; how to acquire accurate time information is critical for the synchronization control. This paper presents a method of synchronization control and time information processing as follows: network time is initialized by time stripping; and then sensor nodes get sampling time information by dual-process synchronization control; gateway optimize the time information by smoothing compensation algorith. This method can prevent the impact for time information caused by time synchronization and loss of packet during the high-frequency acquisition, and increase reliability for the field diagnosis in SHM. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

   on agent (Retracted Article)

   2011

DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication

SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Pedestrian evacuation; Simulation; Agent; Cellular automata; sub-group;
   microscopic Model
AB In this paper, we propose a Micro-modeling approach for pedestrian dynamics, which based on the agent technology. For this model, a computer program is developed to simulate and analyze evacuation phenomenon in sports stadium. Firstly, researches have analyzed the modeling method of agent and environment; the evacuation used the method of gird generation in venues and building individual decision-making model by agent. Secondly, we mainly study the behavior of sub-group, in order to reproduce the behavior, three cases have been studied to analyze the impact of evacuation. Simulation processes and results display that the model is very close to real movements of people. Therefore, this model can be used for the design of sports stadium and as the basis of command plans. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Modeling and Simulating Research of Integrated Fuzzy Control
   for Automobile Steering Stability (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE four-wheel steering; direct yaw-moment control; handling stability;
   fuzzy control
ID YAW-MOMENT CONTROL; ACTIVE SAFETY
AB In this paper, four-wheel steering and direct yaw-moment integrated fuzzy controller is designed. To verify the effectiveness of the integrated fuzzy controller, a nonlinear three-degree-of-freedom model is employed for computer simulation. Considering the nonlinear effects of tyre, Pacejka tyre model was adopted to set up the nonlinear vehicle dynamic model. Simulation on the nonlinear vehicle with integrated controller in Matlab/Simulink software environment was described for a step input. The simulations suggest, compared with FWS and 4WS, the integrated controller can make the handling and stability performance on big lateral acceleration and slip angle improved, and make the driver drive the vehicle normally. The conclusion can be useful for the system design of vehicle stability control system. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: A dynamic modeling methodology to fixed plane joint interface
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Fixed plane joint interface; Virtual material; Hertz contact theory;
   Fractal geometry theory; Experimental modal analysis
AB The concept of virtual material was advised when the flexible joint interface may be considered as a virtual material with the same cross area. The virtual material is rigidly connected with two components situated in both sides of flexible joint interface. Adding an element, a complex assembled part including a joint interface could be equaled as a simple component without any joint interface in order to simplify the complicated problem about flexible joint interface. The interaction between normal and tangential characteristics of fixed interface taken into account, a variety of exact analytic solutions of elastic modulus, shear modulus, Poisson ratio and density were deduced from virtual material through Hertz contact theory and fractal geometry theory. Using experimental results about a series of test specimens, exact analytic expressions for virtual material's parameters were verified in terms of qualitative comparison principle of resembling vibration shapes and quantitative comparison principle of natural frequencies. Virtual material model vibration shapes show excellent agreement with experimental results. The relative deviations between the virtual material model natural frequencies and experimental ones are between -3% and 10%. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 China Three Gorges Univ, Coll Mech & Mat Engn, Yichang 443002, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Optimal Layout of Pressure Monitoring Points in Water
   Distribution Systems Based on Improved Genetic Algorithm (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE water distribution system; pressure monitoring point; optimal layout;
   sensitivity value; the improved genetic algorithm
AB The traditional pressure monitoring points layout of water distribution system is unreasonable, which cannot effectively and accurately reflect the running state of the pipe network when some pipe has busted, a model of optimal layout of pressure monitoring points in water distribution system is put forward to solve this problem. It takes accumulative sensitivity value and maximum variance of sensitivity value of pressure monitoring points as the objective function, the improved genetic algorithm is introduced to solve the problem, which better solves the defect of duplication of coding when the collocation of pressure monitoring points is optimized with the standard genetic operation. The results of the model can be selected to ensure that the selected measuring points not only can control bursting accidents but also lock the regional to the greatest extent. The application value of the method is verified by a simulation. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Research on the New Channel Estimation Algorithm for
   MIMO-OFDM System Based on Training Sequence (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE channel estimation; MIMO-OFDM; training sequence; new algorithm
AB Supporting high mobility will be an important character of the future wireless communication systems. It challenges the channel estimation technique a lot and there are two tough problems in front of us, they are multi-path fading channel and bandwidth efficiency. Orthogonal Frequency Division Multiplexing (OFDM) technique changed the frequency selective multi-path fading channel into flat fading channel in frequency domain which effectively mitigates the effects of multi-path propagation and, hence, increase data rate. In this paper, we discuss the principle of MIMO-OFDM systems based on the introduction of fading channels. Furthermore, the channel estimation technique in MIMO-OFDM system is investigated, with the emphasis on training-assisted channel estimation method. Firstly, we summarize and analyses the exiting channel estimation methods in MIMO-OFDM system. Secondly, we proposed a new channel estimation method for MIMO-OFDM system based on training sequence. A novel pilot pattern with higher frequency efficiency is established and we use a reasonable manner to insert pilot so that the system greatly reduced the training cycle, increased data rates. Finally, in order to track the time-varying channel, an improved direct decision method is further adopted. Theoretical analysis and numerical results show that the new channel estimation scheme can offer a good performance and a high ability to track the time-varying channel. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 Chongqing Univ Arts & Sci, Sch Comp, Chongqing 402160, Peoples R China.
RP Yang, ZG (reprint author), Chongqing Univ Arts & Sci, Sch Comp, Chongqing 402160, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Research on Interference Suppression of Pseudo-random Code
   Phase Modulation Fuse Based on EDTWD Analysis method (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE EDTWD; pseudo-random code phase modulation fuse; interference
   suppression; adaptive interference cancellation
AB The anti-jamming ability of pseudo-random code phase modulation fuse is very strong. But the effectiveness of suppressing narrow-band interference is limited by the signal bandwidth. Thus, an effective method is developed to identify the narrow-band interference in the wide-band spread spectrum signal. Extended discrete-time Wigner-Ville distribution (EDTWD) analysis method is adopted to extract and reconstruct the narrow-band interference in the received signal of pseudo-random code phase modulation fuse. Then the interference is cancelled by the adaptive interference cancellation. The method doesn't require any prior knowledge of interference signal, makes the received signal distorted little and can also be used in the circumstance of some interference sources. The simulation result showed that the interference signal after being separated and then synthesized had the similar frequency characteristics as before. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zhang Qing-hui; Yin Da-feng] Henan Univ Technol, Sch Informat Sci & Technol, Zhengzhou 45001, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Improved differential evolution algorithm for solving WTA
   problem (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE WTA; differential evolution; across; aberrance
AB Weapon-Target Assignment problem (WTA) is a Nonlinear Programming problem and complicated. Using improved Differential Evolution (DE) algorithm to solve WTA problems is proposed. To avoid drawbacks of basic DE for solving optimal problem, such as being subject to falling into local optimization and unfitting to solve questions that is un-continuous, a new coding way of original swarm is established, which reduced the solution space. Furthermore, some improvement in the aberrance and intercross of standard DE was made to make it applicable to WTA. Simulation results demonstrate that the algorithm can converge to the ideal steady state with high speed and provide practical solutions, especially when the scale of WTA problem is big. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Fault Localization through Reasoning and SAT Solving
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE fault diagnosing; assumption-based reasoning; satisfiability;
   constraint; counterexample
ID EXPLAINING COUNTEREXAMPLES; DIAGNOSIS
AB Model checking is an efficient technique for detecting errors of a system. However diagnosing program faults are most time consuming hard work. One of the major advantages of model checking is the production of a counterexample when a property violation is detected. The error trace produced by a model checker may exhibit the symptom related to the cause of errors. Thus, counterexamples can be enough and are indicative for the cause of violation of the property. We present an assumption-based approach to localize the cause of a property violation using reasoning with constraints. The assumption among the statements in counterexample is made to point out which statement(s) is (are) faulty. Some constraints will be introduced from the specifications of the program. Moreover, we transform the counterexample into a propositional logic formula which is then fed to a SAT solver or a theorem prover together with constraints. A calculus of reasoning with these constraints proceeds under a certain assumption. If the result is satisfied, the assumption is correct (we localize errors in those statements which the assumption suppose them to be faulty), otherwise, the assumption is wrong and another assumption should be made. Some examples support the applicability and effectiveness of our approach. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Pu, Fei] Zhejiang Gongshang Univ, Coll Comp & Informat Engn, Hangzhou 310018, Zhejiang, Peoples R China.
RP Pu, F (reprint author), Zhejiang Gongshang Univ, Coll Comp & Informat Engn, Hangzhou 310018, Zhejiang, Peoples R China.
EM pufei@mail.zjgsu.edu.cn

TI RETRACTED: Robust Control for Nonlinear Uncertain Systems Using
   Parameter Dependent Lyapunov Functions (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE polynomial nonlinear system; prameter-dependent Lyapunov method; sum of
   squares; nonlinear matix inequality
ID STABILITY CONDITIONS; OPTIMIZATION; SUM
AB This note provides sufficient robust stability conditions for continuous time polytopic nonlinear systems. Parameter-dependent Lyapunov functional is introduced in order to make possible the state feedback robust control synthesis, and less conservative sufficient conditions are formulated in terms of nonlinear state dependent matrix inequalities. These conditions can be verified by the technique of sum of squares (SOS) approach.. Numerical example is included for illustration. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Novel Efficient Query Strategy for the Deep Web Data
   Integration System (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Deep Web; Data Integration System; Inquiry; Hit Rate
ID OPTIMIZATION
AB There is tremendous rich information "hidden" in the Deep Web. With the Deep Web data integration system, we can get abundant helpful information we need. To build a practical and useful Deep Web data integration system, one of the key problems is to raise the query efficiency; in this paper, adopting the idea of high-speed cache, we get the most frequent and commonest keywords sequences by mining the user query logs. And we store in advance the query results of the most frequent and commonest keywords sequences in the local index database of the Deep Web data integration system so as to lead to a decrease in query time and an increase in query quality. In order to elevate the hit rate of query and reduce the query time, a well-designed logical pattern and corresponding strategy for updating the content of the local index database are proposed. Finally, a theoretical analysis is made of the query strategies put forward. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: NMLCS: A Novel Parallel Algorithm for Searching for the
   Multiple Longest Common Subsequences (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE MLCS; match; parallel processing
ID LCS
AB Searching for the multiple longest common subsequences (MLCS) has found significant applications in the areas of bioinformatics, information processing, data mining, etc. There is a variety of MLCS algorithms, but none of the existing algorithms give effective solutions under the condition of a large alphabet, a considerable number of sequences and a long average length of sequences. Aiming at the defects of the MLCS algorithms available, this paper proposes a novel parallel algorithm for the MLCS-NMLCS based on the ideas of parallel processing and match pair by pre-processing. Experimental results show that our NMLCS resolves the problems mentioned above with great efficiency and significantly reduces time-space complexity as compared with other MLCS algorithms. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: A Study of Meandered Microstrip Coupler With Dielectric Cover
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Coupler; dielectric cover; Directivity; Coupling
ID DIRECTIONAL-COUPLERS; DESIGN; CIRCUITS
AB A novel design technique to improve the directivity of a microstrip direction coupler by a meandered structure with dielectric cover is proposed in this paper. Increasing of even-mode phase velocity by the proposed meandering method structure with dielectric cover is reported for the first time. An analytical method to obtain closed-form equations of even-mode, phase velocity is developed. The proposed structure is verified by experiments. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Design of an Economical Compact Coaxial cavity Combline
   Filter for 3G TD Base station (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE coupling coefficient; combline filter; CST; Coupling Matrix Synthesis
ID COUPLING MATRIX; MICROWAVE FILTERS; RESONATOR FILTERS
AB The cross coupled microwave filter is widely used in the communication sub system. The synthesis of the cross coupled filter is from prescribed transmission zeros and return loss till the attainment of the coupling matrix of each cavity. A compact narrowband combline high rejection filter with cross coupled is presented. A configuration using identical resonator post with capacitance-loading is introduced. Tested results show that with order-8 filter center frequency at 2017.5MHz, return loss lower than -25dB can be achieved over a relative bandwidth of 1.29%. Sample filter has been fabricated and tested result confirmed the theory results. In this paper, tested results will be given to illustrate the concept. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The rolling angle feedback based coordinated stable control
   law design of UAV (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE aircraft control; unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV); coordinated stability;
   integrated guidance and control (IGC)
ID EVOLUTIONARY ALGORITHM
AB The coordinated stable control of an UAV with the reconnaissance and attack task is considered in this paper. Arc circle is introduced before turning to reduce recognition difficult of electro-optical pod. The integrated guidance and control system design method is used for UAV due to the good characters of the pitching mode, rolling mode and Dutch Roll mode of the linearized ontology mode. The altitude hold strategy and rolling angle feedback based coordinated turning strategy are applied respectively to accomplish the reconnaissance and attack task. The six freedom degree simulations are given to illustrate the efficiency of the proposed method. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Design of Low Noise Distributed Amplifier with Adjustable
   gain control in 0.15um GaAs PHEMT (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE distributed amplifiers; adjustable gain control; cascode structure; low
   noise
AB In this paper, a distributed amplifier with adjustable gain control is designed based on 0.15um GaAs PHEMT which consists of nine gain cells, and the novel cascode structure is adopted to extend the output voltage and bandwidth. The amplifier provides 16dB high gain with only 2.5dB noise figure in a wide band from 2 to 24GHz and the gain flatness is excellent +/- 0.2dB from 3.5-23.5GHz. An optional gate bias is specially designed to allow greater than 10dB gain control range. The circuit requires only 60mA from a +5V supply and the area is 2.36*1.01mm2. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Formal Specification for a Reflection-based Coordination
   Model Using PiOZ (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE software architecuture; reuse; reflection; coordination model; PiOZ
AB This paper proposes the way of specification by which the CM4AR can be formally described in the PiOZ. CM4AR (coordination model for architecture reuse), which is constructed and designed on the basis of architectural reflection theory, can provides the support for reusing software architecture and its constituents at design time. CM4AR is logically divided into meta-level and base-level. When CM4AR is used to support architecture reuse, the interaction between meta-level and base-level will occur and the two levels in the CM4AR must be consistent all the time. The consistency between the two levels is ensured by the correctness of causal connection between the two levels. In this paper we propose the formal specification for the CM4AR in order to characterize the causal connection between meta-level and base-level precisely. So there are three parts of the formal specification, including the formal specification of base-level, meta-level and interaction between two levels. The result of this paper is the foundation for proving the correctness of causal connection between two levels in the future. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Ye, Peng; Hu, Ming] Wuhan Text Univ, Coll Math & Comp, Wuhan 430073, Peoples R China.

   2011

CL Singapore, SINGAPORE

DE Target classification; Interest points; Bag of words; Probabilistic
   Latent Semantic Analysis(PLSA)
AB In this paper, we present a novel classifying method for vehicle and pedestrian categories in intelligent traffic surveillance. A dual-layer Bag-of-Words model solve the problem of detecting and recognizing the moving vehicles and pedestrian. In the learning and recognizing stage a two-layer Probabilistic Latent Semantic Analysis is proposed. The experimental results show that the classification and recognition method achieved higher accuracy and speed at the outside compared to existing methods. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Jacobian Algorithm on Features Selection and Evaluation of
   CHES-FY System (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Fabric; characterization; fuzzy; feature; physical properties
ID HANDLE EVALUATION SYSTEM; FABRICS
AB The main content dealt with in the paper was to adopt fuzzy algorithm to select features for characterizing multiple physical properties, which were acquired from the pulling-out force and distance curve by a new apparatus. It was a comprehensive handle evaluation system for fabrics and yarns (CHES-FY), which can reflect weight, bending, friction and tension properties as well as stiffness tactile. The paper presented the structure and principle of the CHES-FY system, and the Jacobian algorithm and Karhunen-Loeve (K-L) transformation were used to obtain several features selected from the pulling-out force and distance curve for the experimental fabrics. These features were proved to be effective in characterizing weight, bending, friction and tensile properties of fabric by comparisons with measured results by standard testers. There existed good correlations in utilizing these features selected by fuzzy algorithm to evaluate physical behaviour of fabrics. It indicated that it was greatly helpful for fuzzy method in the application of textile fabrics fields. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Locating of the earth fault of the single-phase at the tree
   distribution network (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE fault location; selection of line mode; tree distribution network;
   ranging the traveling wave
AB This paper proposes method through the combination of ranging the C-type traveling wave and the analysis and selection of line to the component of the line mode to locate the fault point. Inject into high amplitude and narrow signals in the beginning of a line and detect circuit returning from the arrival time of the waveform. Comparing of the normal waveform and failure waveform in both cases, receive the reflected wave fault at the arrival time. And then determine the fault distance. Using the effect from the fault which generating the shocks of the traveling wave and comparing the shock time of each branch line, the line which acquires the longest duration of vibration is the fault line. Through the theoretical analysis, Matlab simulation and effective analysis of the selected data, this paper proves the correctness of the method and demonstrates that the method of fault location in distribution networks is practical. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

   Based on Haar (Retracted Article)

DE Time Series; Haar Wavelets; Similarity Pattern Mining
AB Time series data mining is a rather complex branch, which is a technique that extracts the most valuable information from large amount of his(a)tory time series data. Haar wavelet technology will be used in time series similarity-pattern mining. This dissertation discusses the problem on time series similarity-pattern mining from similarity measurement, storage structure, searching integrality. Finally simulation results show that the Haar wavelet technology used in time-series similar pattern mining in a good performance. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd.    2011

DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE

DE emotion; Sequential evolutionary game; Learning mechanism; simulation
AB A novel model which introduces emotion character is proposed to simulate group game process more truly. According to different kinds of agents, this model builds individual learning mechanism and Strategy mutation mechanism based on emotion character. The Simulations show that the learning ability promotes individual's even cooperation rate of game and improves group total payoff. And, simulations also show that emotion factor would lead to dramatically fluctuation, whereas has little influences on group even total payoff. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Loss analysis of three-level active neutral-point-clamped
   converter under fault tolerance operation (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE loss; three-level A(a)NPC; fault tolerant operation; modulation strategy
ID INVERTERS
AB Compared with traditional three-level neutral-point-clamped (NPC) converter, the recently proposed three-level active NPC (ANPC) converter has the ability to overcome the unbalanced loss distribution, and therefore result in increased output power or switching frequency. In industrial applications, fault tolerance ability of power converters is very important considering system availability, safety and reliability. This paper introduced the control schemes to get stable and continuous output under single device fault for both open-circuit and short-circuit fault cases. By analyzing the phase relationship of reference voltage and load current, the loss calculation method under fault tolerant operation was proposed. Calculation results show that the devices junction temperatures under fault tolerant operation are within the safe operation area (SOA) even they are a little bit higher compared to normal operation, which also confirm the effectiveness of the fault tolerant control schemes. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE wireless sensor networks; ZigBee; monitoring nodes; JN5139; agricultural

AB The intelligent agricultural environment monitoring system is one of the applications of wireless sensor networks, which has an extensive application and bright foreground. Monitoring nodes, as the basic unit of an intelligent monitoring system for agricultural environment, are the basic unit to realize the monitoring function. A solution of such monitoring nodes based on JN5139 is proposed. The paper briefly presents the architecture of the nodes and introduces the design of each part. The monitoring nodes can obtain the temperature, humidity and illumination information in real time, and then transferred to the remote monitoring center. TI RETRACTED: A New Method of Paper Defect Recognition Based on Wavelet
   Packet Decomposition and BP Neural Network (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE paper defect recognition; feature vector; wavelet packet decomposition;
   BP neural network
AB A new approach of paper defect recognition is proposed. To implement this method, computer is used to acquire paper image and the subtraction algorithm is used to determine if the image contains defect at first. For the image with paper defect, wavelet packet decomposition is applied to extracting the feature vector of the defect. A BP neural network is designed for recognizing the defect type according to the feature vector. This approach provides a unified detection algorithm for different types of paper defects. The experiment data prove this method is valid and can be applied in modern paper defect inspection system. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Runtime Prediction of Armored Vehicle Engine Based on Neural
   Network (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE BP neural network; prediciton; armred vehicle engine
AB To a great extent, engine's runtime of armored vehicle reflects its technical state. By estimating engine's runtime, the remaining service life can be forecasted. In this paper, the virtues of neural network prediction are introduced. Aiming at a certain armored vehicle engine, the BP neural network regression prediction model is constructed based on four typical state parameters including cylinder compression pressures, acceleration time, deceleration time and supply fuel advance angle. The model is trained and validated by samples data. The prediction results indicate that the model is effective and feasible. At last, two prediction problems that need to be studied hard are proposed. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

DE tracking; fuzzy control; ant colony algorithm

DE armored equipment; maintenance; PHM; aFMEA; module
AB In view of some shortcomings of armored equipment maintenance, Prognostics and Health Management (PHM) technology was introduced. Aiming at an armored vehicle engine, augmented-Failure Mode and Effect Analysis(aFMEA) was proceeded. Analysis on failure symptoms and sensor installation was introduced into the traditional FMEA method, aFMEA is no longer limited to static analysis on failure mode and effect. Based on the description of function requirement definition and development process, the structure of armored equipment PHM system was established, its function module was designed as well. DE Hardware-in-the-loop (HIL); real-time simulation (RTS); automated
   software testing; test environment; software system testing; test model
AB This paper presents a hardware-in-loop (HIL) real-time simulation environment for embedded software testing, namely the Embedded Software Simulation Test Environment (ESSTE). We give a detailed description of methods, architecture and critical components of ESSTE. TI RETRACTED: Influence and countermeasures for protection of distribution
   network when wind farms connected (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Windfarm operation; Distribution network; Protection; Impact; Adaptive
   protection
AB In order to research the influence of Grid-connected with wind farm to protection in distribution system, in this article a simulation model of Grid-connected with a 3 MW wind farm is constructed. Three-phase short circuit faults at the point in the transmission line and at the access point of the wind farm are simulated. In both short-circuit case weather the wind farm exist or not the differences is analyzed. Simulation results show that in order to ensure the stable operation of the system, the wind farms' impact to the system can not be ignored. Finally, an new method of protection is proposed, the grid which connect with wind farms is divided into several areas, the protection device cut the fault zone in time, while other regions will not be affected (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: The short-time spectrum analysis of real-time sampling speech
   with DSP TMS320VC5416 chip (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Short-time spectrum analysis; FFT algorithm; The proceeding of real-time
   sampling speech; DSP TMS320VC5416
ID RECOGNITION
AB For automatic speech recognition (ASR), the research centers mainly on algorithm of improving robust, researchers put less emphasis on realization and application of better speech algorithm. Real-time proceeding of speech recognition directly influence on its application, so real-time proceeding of speech recognition is as important as study of algorithm. Speech transform domain method is a necessary technique of speech recognition, so real-time analysis of transform domain method is necessary. In transform domain methods, the short-time spectrum analysis is simple and easy to realize, especially the short-time FFT algorithm is applied to the short-time spectrum analysis. FFT algorithm reduces multiplications greatly. For the purpose, this paper presents short-time spectrum analysis of real-time sampling speech based on FFT algorithm. We use DSP TMS320VC5416 chip and speech codec ASIC TLV320AIC23 as hardware, the real-time speech signal is acquired by ASIC TLV320AIC23. When working frequency of TMS320VC5416 is set 160 MHz and sampling frequency is 44.1 kHz, the short-time FFT is radix-2 DIF-FFT algorithm and the length of short-time window is 128, the simulation waves and data show that the short-time FFT algorithm analysis based on TMS320VC5416 chip can meet real-time of system. For estimation of proceeding error, we make a calculation of radix-2 DIT-IFFT. Comparing the result of DIT-IFFT and sampling speech data, error is less than 10(-3). (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Study of Software Requirement Risk Based on Fuzzy Influence
   Diagram (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Software requirement risk; influence diagram; fuzzy influence diagram;
   relation; node; arc; fuzzy matrix
AB Fuzzy influence diagram is combination of fuzzy maths and influence diagram, which is applied to account probability of software requirement risk in this thesis. It's introduced for the basic knowledge of fuzzy influence diagram and factors are selected from software requirement engineering which may result in software requirement risk. Relation level of those risk factors is shown by influence diagram, while function level and value level are analyzed by fuzzy maths. An example is given to demonstrate the feasibility and applicability of fuzzy influence diagram to account probability of software requirement risk. At last, algorithm steps are summarized for applying influence diagram and the main two difficulty of the application is indicated. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. DE Particle Swarm Optimization; Powell Algorithm; Function Optimization
AB This paper presents an improved crossover PSO by introducing the linear inertia weight and linear adaptive learning rates to crossover PSO to overcome the shortcoming of premature convergence and trapping in local optimum solution. Further more, a hybrid algorithm based on improved crossover PSO and Powell is proposed to enhance both global and local searching ability. The simulation results show the improved performance. TI RETRACTED: Object Location based on Radon transform Phase correlation
   and Up-sampling (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Radon transforms; phase correlation; up-sampling; object location
AB In order to resolve the problem of high accurate location for accurate electronic assembly equipments, a novel method based on Radon transform, phase correlation and up-sampling is presented in this paper for object location. Firstly, the Radon transform is applied to convert the region of objects from Cartesian coordinates to Polar coordinates, and the translation and rotation in Cartesian coordinates will be converted to translation in Polar coordinates. Then, the phase correlation and up-sampling technique will be combined to obtain high accurate sub-pixel translation estimation. Finally, the rotation and translation of objects in Cartesian coordinates will be estimated accurately. Experimental results verified the proposed method which is also applied in the real time mounting components for accurate electronic assembly. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Rotational Angle Detection Based on Projection and Upsampling
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Projections; Upsampling; Rotational angle; Mounting components
ID ROBUST
AB Since the diversity of shapes among surface mounting components in precision electronic assembly, it has become more difficult for locating inspection of surface mounting components. In this paper, we have proposed a novel method for angle detection based on projections. Firstly, a strong connection between the rotation angle and the support length will be constructed. Then, the proposed method for angle detection based on projections will be given in detail. Next, the accuracy of the proposed method will be analyzed. To improve the accuracy of the angle detection, the zero-padding interpolation method is successfully applied. Experiments results show that the present method is effective, accurate and efficient for angle detection. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Select Algorithm for Local Certificate Repository of
   Self-organized Key Management Scheme in Ad hoc Networks (Retracted
   Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Ad hoc net work; self-organized key management; certificate chain;
   select algorithm
AB Click here and insert your abstract text. Based on the Maximum Degree Construction algorithm, a new select algorithm is proposed in this paper. In the algorithm, each node and its neighbors issue the certificates each other to generate the local In-degree and Out-degree certificate repository. Similar to the ant colony algorithm, it finds the certificate chain between the source node and destination node by selecting the node of the maximum certificated times from the beginning. The algorithm reduces the complexity of the selection, provides a guarantee to find the certificate chain, and saves the spending of space as well. Next, this paper gives the simulation of the algorithm and the simulated results show that this is an optimized select algorithm for local certificate repository. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Relationship between the quantity of sampled stars and the
   ePSF mode's accuracy in Astrometry (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Effective Point-spread Function; PSF Mode; Undersampled Image;
   Positional Measurement; Astrometry
AB Effective point-spread function (ePSF) method is an excellent method for the positional measurements of stars in undersampled stellar images, whose critical step is deriving an accurate ePSF mode. In the presentation, we investigate the effects of the grid density and the sample density on the mode's accuracy through some experiments on positional measurement in synthetic undersampled stellar images. We find that constructing a stable ePSF mode requires two samples in every cell (basic unit of pixel segmentation) for a certain grid. That is, ideally, 2n(2) sampled stars in a stellar image are enough for constructing a stable ePSF mode. Whether the derived stable ePSF mode is accurate is related to the grid density, the denser the mode's grid is, the more accurate it is. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Zhang, Qingfeng; He, Haifeng; Peng, Qingyu] Jinan Univ, Sino French Joint Lab Astrometry Dynam & Space Sc, Guangzhou 510632, Guangdong, Peoples R China.
RP Zhang, QF (reprint author), Jinan Univ, Sino French Joint Lab Astrometry Dynam & Space Sc, Guangzhou 510632, Guangdong, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: Research and Development of the Enviroment
   Measurement-Control System in Greenhouse (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE greenhouse; the measurement-control system; sensor; information fusion
AB This paper introduces a control system on the environment in greenhouse. By detecting the environmental factors in the greenhouse such as air temperature, air humidity, soil moisture, light intensity and the density of co2, etc, the environment measurement-control system can fit the environment in greenhouse for the crop growth well by controlling the heater, pumps and other facilities, which is important to improve the agro-ecological and production conditions effectively, promote the scientific development of agricultural resources and the rational use of land utilization and the labor productivity. Based on the environment measurement-control system, the automatic scientific production and management in greenhouse is realized. This paper has a research on the development of the hardware and the software of the system, and escribes the development of the control system from a single intelligent node to the complex network system, and introduces the error processing technology, the multi-sensor information fusion technology and the fuzzy expert system applied in the software design. Besides these, this paper analysizes the problems in the system and predicts its further development. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Research on Network Data Fusion Based on Wireless Sensor
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Wireless sensor; data fusion
AB Wireless sensor network is a field of information technology in recent years. In order to obtain accurate and timely information and to ensure the robustness of sensor network, sensor nodes must monitor to some extent. There is overlap, so the sensor node and the data collected is some redundancy [6]. To avoid this problem, wireless sensor network in the process of data collection need to adopt data fusion (data aggregation or data fusion) technology. This paper introduces wireless sensor network data fusion concepts and roles, and it analyzes the data fusion in wireless sensor networks the major technical challenges. It describes the data fusion that is currently the main model, and finally, we give the wireless sensor networks main fusion. We hope that the contents of this article in the wireless sensor network for the majority of researchers in data integration to provide a reference. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Automatic knot adjustment for B-spline surface approximation
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE B-spline surface; Estimation of distribution algorithm; Gaussian mixture
   moldel; Knot adjustment; Expectations maximization algorithm
AB Fairing B-spline surface is regarded as one major precondition for surface reconstruction. To obtain a good surface approximation, a novel method is proposed in this paper. The knots of the B-spline surface are treated as variables, and are optimized by the estimation of distribution algorithm. The initial knots are decided by the parameterization of the measured data points. The experiment results show that this method can obtain more precise surface approximate. TI RETRACTED: A priori error estimates of mixed methods for optimal control
   problems governed by parabolic equations (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE a priori error estimates; mixed finite element method; general parabolic
   optimal control problems
ID FINITE-ELEMENT METHODS
AB In this paper, we investigate a priori error estimates of mixed finite element methods for general optimal control problem governed by parabolic equations. The state and co-state are approximated by the Raviart-Thomas mixed finite element spaces and the control is approximated by piecewise constant functions. We derive a priori error estimates for the state and the control approximation of parabolic optimal control problem. Finally, we present a numerical example which confirms the theoretical results. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Design of A Four-annulus Integrated Disk Electrode for
   Bioelectrical Impedance Spectroscopy Measurement (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE bioelectrical impedance spectroscopy; pork quality; four-annulus
   integrated disk electrode; Cole-Cole model
ID ELECTRICAL-IMPEDANCE; PROBE
AB In order to study the relationships between pork quality and the BIS of porcine tissues, a novel four-annulus integrated disk (FAID) electrode was designed and manufactured. The contrastive measurement experiments on two fresh isolated animal tissues, namely porcine underback and porcine liver using the FAID electrode were performed. The results show that the impedance amplitude-frequency characteristics and phase-frequency characteristics of the two kinds of tissues have significant differences. The Cole-Cole parameters fitting are then performed using the measured BIS data. The fitting results show that the arrangement of the BIS data on the complex plane is in good concordance with the Cole-Cole plot respectively, and the extracted results, R0, R infinity, alpha and fC, also indicate the difference between the two tissues. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: The Variance of Measurement of Sound Absorption of Material
   in the Underwater Reverberation Chamber (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE sound absorption coefficient; reverberation chamber; reverberation time;
   ensemble variance
AB Random-incidence sound absorption coefficient of underwater acoustics materials can be measured by the method of reverberation chamber. Method of reverberation chamber used in underwater acoustics area is analog to national standard (GBJ 47 similar to 83) about "Measurement of sound absorption in a reverberation room" in air acoustics area. The ensemble variance has a great impact to the accuracy of sound absorption coefficient of underwater acoustics material. The accuracy of sound absorption coefficient can be guaranteed by reducing the ensemble variance in the measurement of reverberation time. Ensemble variance is influenced by the uniformity of the sound field, the excitation mode of source and the variation of volume. temperature and air bubble of water. The maximum value of ensemble variance approaches 10%. The value of ensemble variance can reduce to 3% by some effective methods. Results of this research are helpful to reduce the errors in the measurement of sound absorption coefficient of under water acoustic material. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
C1 [Yang Daheng; Li Qi] Harbin Engn Univ, Coll Underwater Acoust Engn, Harbin 150001, Peoples R China.

TI RETRACTED: A Hybrid Approach Based on Genetic Algorithms and Iterative
   Fourier Techniques for the Synthesis of Large Planar Thinned Arrays
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE genetic algorithm (GA); iterative Fourier technique (IFT); sidelobe
   control; thinned arrays
ID FFT TECHNIQUES
AB A hybrid approach for the synthesis of large planar thinned antenna arrays is presented. The proposed solution exploits and combines the most attractive features of a binary genetic algorithm (GA) and those of a newly developed iterative Fourier technique (IFT). Numerical experiments show improvements of the proposed solution with respect to previous results. It can significantly reduce computational complexity comparing with conventional GAs, also avoids the defect of IFTs that it is easy to be trapped into local minima. DE Fractional-order control system; (PID mu)-D-lambda controller;

DE 3-d solid modeling; spiral bevel gear; error; measurement; evaluation
AB It is very important to get real factor and ideal factor for the spiral bevel gear's error measurement and evaluation. According to its complexity tooth surface shape, the real factor was gotten by CMM which could measure the coordinates of the intersection points in the real gear tooth surface. For the ideal factor, this paper proposed that it was gotten by building the 3d solid modeling in UG based on the gear's basic parameters and cutter head parameters. The application of 3d solid modeling in spiral bevel gear's error measurement and evaluation was explained by measuring and evaluating the automobile rear axle's driven gear. The result shows that this way is very effective and feasible. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

TI RETRACTED: Local Color Transfer Algorithm Based on CTWC and the
   Application in Styled Rendering of Yunnan Heavy Color Painting
   (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE Local color transfer; CTWC; Yunnan Heavy Color Painting;
   non-photorealistic rendering
AB In this paper, a local color transfer algorithm based on CTWC (Color Transfer Weight Coefficients) is proposed. Firstly, interactively select one or more corresponding areas in the original image and the target image, those colors need to transfer. Secondly, use the low pass Butterworth filter function to calculate the CTWC of each selected areas in the original image. The CTWC represents the influence degree of color transformation of the pixels in the selected areas of the original image, and the value of CTWC is inversely proportional to the color statistical distance of the selected corresponding areas between the original and target image. Finally, the Reinhard Algorithm is improved by the calculation method of CTWC and gets the local color transfer algorithm based on CTWC. For multi-regional local color transfer, an iterative image merge method is proposed to fuse the multi-regional local color transformation's result images. In the end, the color transfer is used for Yunnan heavy color painting digital simulation and stylized rendering and the results of experiment shows it can obviously improve the rendering effect. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.

   dynamic simulation
ID ARCHITECTURE; NETWORKS
AB In obstacle-dense environments and uneven terrain, jumping can be a very efficient mode of locomotion for small robots. In this paper, a novel foldable jumping mechanism is proposed and the design of a miniature robot with a hybrid motion pattern of jumping and rolling is presented. DE Remote control; Virtual server; Network time-delay; Model predictive
   control
ID CONTROL-SYSTEMS; STABILITY
AB Aiming at the security issues, the construction of the remote motor control server based on the Web is studied, the scheme of two server programs based on the virtual server technology is proposed. The safety and application occasion of the scheme are described respectively, and the encryption algorithm which Improve certification accuracy is proposed. Aiming at the real-time problem, a new control method is proposed, which is based on neural network predictive control to solve the existing closed-loop network control system random delay. The experiment verification and system simulated are completed. These methods provide a new way to integrate the control network and information network, and to lay a solid foundation for the development of the control network. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. TI RETRACTED: Robust Networks for Initial Alignment of Strap-down Inertial
   Navigation Systems (Retracted Article)
SO 2011 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE-ICEES
   2011
SE Energy Procedia
LA English
DT Proceedings Paper; Retracted Publication
CT International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science (ICEES)
CY OCT, 2011
CL Singapore, SINGAPORE
SP Singapore Inst Elect (SIE)
DE SINS; initial alignment; Kalman filter; neural networks; H infinity
   filter
AB This paper presents a method for the initial alignment of strap-down inertial navigation system on stationary base. In the coarse alignment, Magnetism compass and accelerometer are used to get the initial pose angles. In the precise alignment, radial basis function network (RBF network), in which radial function chosen by averaging method and weights adjusted by an improved H infinity robust filter, is applied to correct the pose angles to ensure the robustness and real-time computing. Simulation results show that comparing with ordinary H infinity filter learning algorithm and extended Kalman filter, this method is efficient and rapid for initial alignment. (C) 2011 Published by Elsevier Ltd. Selection and/or peer-review under responsibility of the Organizers of 2011 International Conference on Energy and Environmental Science.
